body:
what about combining multiple languages in one message?
based on a config option we can generate mail messages with multiple languages.

it generally is a good idea to support this, however the question is how to do this. i see two approaches: 

1.) besides the user selecting a language for his session during login or in his profile an additional administrative setting has to be introduced to select the localization used for content generation. this setting would have to be improved to allow to select multiple languages and their order. 
possible, but not very flexible. i doubt it is a good approach. 

2.) instead of using hard coded text templates for content generation it should be possible to modify the templates. the initialization of the templates should be based on the primary language chosen (see additional setting in the first approach above). from then on the local administration can modify the templates content. for example by adding further translations. 
in my eyes this makes more sense, since typically multi language content is _not_ a simple concatenation of the text in different translations. instead it typically contains some common introduction and content in a primary language plus additional information in one or more additional languages. so the content of the text for different languages actually differ. 
this approach would mean to implement a text template administration. not a complex one but still...

i'd say: 
* first take care to decouple the localizations at all. 
* then, in a second step, this candy could be implemented on top.
